page.title: 01SUMMARY OF THE AREA
page.content: LEEK IS A TOWN SITUATED IN THE NORTH OF STAFFORDSHIRE CLOSE TO THE BORDERS OF DERBYSHIRE AND CHESHIRE. LEEK IS KNOWN AS "THE QUEEN OF THE MOORLANDS" DUE TO ITS POSITION IN THE STAFFORDSHIRE MOORLANDS. LEEK IS UNUSUAL IN A WAY AS IT IS A BUSY MARKET TOWN SURROUNDED BY HILLS, MOORS AND DALES. THE TOWN HAS A POPULATION OF APPROX.20,000 AND SPRANG UP AS A PLACE WHERE FARMERS FROM A LARGE AREA CAME TO BUY AND SELL PRODUCE. LEEK IS ALSO AN INDUSTRIAL TOWN WHICH HAS SEVERAL TEXTILE MILLS, A BUTTER AND DAIRY PRODUCTS PACKING PLANT AND IS ALSO THE HOME OF A LARGE BUILDING SOCIETY. LEEK HAS A LARGE NUMBER OF AMENITIES INCLUDING MANY DIFFERENT KINDS OF SHOPS AND A WEEKLY MARKET(WHICH WAS GRANTED TO THE TOWN BY KING JOHN).
